title.rendered: Apply Now | Regina University Admission Requirements 2024

content.rendered:
Regina University Admission Requirements for Art History  Degree Bachelor-(BA), Creative Technologies Introduction, and How to apply.

Regina University Admission requirements are ongoing for all interested Candidates who wish to apply; the admission is open for both indigenous and international students.

Campaign College at Regina University

Step to apply into Regina University

  • Click here and fill in the appropriate information
  • After filling click on the login
  • Follow the next procedures

ART HISTORY

Faculty: Media, Art, and Performance
Degree: Bachelor of Arts (BA)

Art History majors will learn to understand art historically and across cultures, as well as the different methods and techniques of a variety of art media.  Art History gives students the tools to conduct research and to interpret and evaluate works of art.

Sample Courses:

Prehistoric and Ancient Art, Medieval Art History, Modern Art and the Avant-Garde, Cultures of Display, Art Theory and Art Criticism.

Career Opportunities:

Graduates pursue careers as Art Dealers, Antique Dealers, Gallery Administrators, Gallery Curators and Owners, Artist Representatives and Exhibition Preparers

To find out the admission requirements for Art History kindly visit here

CREATIVE TECHNOLOGIES

INTRODUCTION TO CREATIVE TECHNOLOGIES;

Creative Technology is an interdisciplinary course that is distinctive in the province. It is an emerging area of learning that brings together artists, scientists, and cultural theorists. It includes a variety of courses from the areas of fine arts, computer science, engineering, and new media, with additional theoretical material drawn from media and communications studies.

Creative Technologies is an opportunity to expand your horizons. Our courses encourage collaboration, experimentation, and lateral thinking. The program combines imagination and innovation in the changing technological setting.

Graduates pursue careers as Art Dealers, Antique Dealers, Gallery Administrators, Gallery Curators and Owners, Artist Representatives, and Exhibition Preparers.

Faculty: Media, Art, and Performance
Degree: Bachelor of Arts (BA)

Explore your creative and technological sides with this concentration, designed to prepare graduates for this exciting emerging field. This program is unique in Saskatchewan.

Other Sample Courses are:

Branding, Advertising, and Design; Visual Communication for the Web; Introduction to Sound Art; Media Empires; preface to Computer Game and VR Design.

Career Opportunities:

Graduates pursue careers in mobile app design and development, animation, digital and web media content design, and more.

To get more information about admission requirements visit here
